page.title: 01Summary
page.content: There are two small villages in the area. They are Kirkpatrick Durham and Old Bridge of Urr. In Old Bridge of Urr there are about 30 people; in Kirkpatrick Durham there are under 100 people. There are a lot of farms and their main land use is for grazing but some have crops which are used to feed the beef cattle in winter. They are Galloway cattle. In the area there is only one shop and post office and that is in Old Bridge of Urr. There is a church in Kirkpatrick Durham and a school but that is closed down. The River Urr is used for fishing because it has good salmon. The A75 is part of the Euro-route to Ireland so that means that large lorries go on the road and a lot of accidents happen because they are going too fast.
